rules.justification: CodeCop - There must be exactly one space character on each side of a binary operator.
CodeCop - There must be no space character between a unary operator and its argument.
CodeCop - There must be exactly one space character between the NOT operator and its argument.
CodeCop - Only use BEGIN..END to enclose compound statements.
CodeCop - Function calls should have parenthesis even if they do not have any parameters.
CodeCop - When BEGIN follows THEN, ELSE, DO, it should be on the same line, preceded by one space characte.
CodeCop - The END, IF, REPEAT, UNTIL, FOR, WHILE, and CASE statement should always start a line.
CodeCop - Variable declarations should be ordered by type.
CodeCop - An IF followed by two or more ELSE IF should be replaced with a CASE.
CodeCop - Avoid using nested WITH statements.
CodeCop - Permission set extensions should not include permissions for objects defined in another application.
CodeCop - Permission set extensions should not include permission sets defined in another application.
CodeCop - Permission set extensions should not include permission sets which include permissions for objects defined in another application.
CodeCop - Permission set extensions should not include wildcard permissions.
CodeCop - The name of variables and parameters must be suffixed with the type or object name.
CodeCop - The name of temporary variable must be prefixed with Temp.
CodeCop - TextConst and Label variable names should have an approved suffix.
CodeCop - Lowering permissions should only be used in tests.
CodeCop - Do not have identifiers with quotes in the name.
CodeCop - Use camel case property values in pages of type API.
CodeCop - Use camel case name for field controls in pages of type API.
CodeCop - Use camel case property values in queries of type API.
CodeCop - Use camel case name for column controls in queries of type API.
CodeCop - String parameters must match placeholders.
CodeCop - Do not write code that will never be hit.
CodeCop - Do not declare variables that are unused.
CodeCop - Do not assign a text to a target with smaller size.
CodeCop - Do not declare parameters by reference if their values are never changed.
CodeCop - Only use AssertError in Test Codeunits.
CodeCop - Only find record if you need to use it.
CodeCop - The FindSet or Find methods must be used only in connection with the Next  method.
CodeCop - Only use a correct values of ApplicationArea.
CodeCop - Only write actions that have an effect.
CodeCop - Do not use identical names for local and global variables.
CodeCop - Use only a correct order for ApplicationArea.
CodeCop - Use only a correct order for ApplicationArea.
CodeCop - When ApplicationArea is set to All, no other values for ApplicationArea should be specified.
CodeCop - When ApplicationArea is set to Basic, you must also specify Suite.
CodeCop - To avoid confusion, do not give local variables the same name as fields, methods, or actions in the same scope.
CodeCop - To avoid confusion, do not give methods the same name as fields or actions in the same scope.
CodeCop - To avoid confusion, do not give global variables the same name as fields, methods, or actions in the same scope.
CodeCop - Variables must be initialized before usage.
CodeCop - The value assigned to a variable must be used.
CodeCop - The EventSubscriber method must be local.
CodeCop - Avoid non-indexed fields into filtering.
CodeCop - Avoids a runtime error from using CalcFields on a field that is not a FlowField or a field of type Blob.
CodeCop - Obsoleted object must have a state Pending or Removed and a justification specifying why this field is being obsoleted.
CodeCop - The local record should be modified before saving to the database.
CodeCop - Follow the style guide about the best practices for naming.
CodeCop - Use a text constant for passing user messages and errors without concatenations.
CodeCop - Use a text constant or label for format string in StrSubstNo.
CodeCop - You must write a tooltip in the Tooltip property for all controls of type Action and Field that exist on page objects.
CodeCop - he Tooltip property of Fields must start with Specifies.
CodeCop - The value of the Tooltip property of Fields must be filled.
CodeCop - You must specify a OptionCaption property for all fields which source expressions is not a table field.
CodeCop - SIFT index should not be used on primary or unique key.
CodeCop - The value of the OptionCaption property of Fields must be filled in.
CodeCop - The count of option captions specified in the OptionCaption property is wrong.
CodeCop - You must specify a caption in the Caption property for Fields that exist on page objects.
CodeCop - The value of the Caption property of Fields must be filled in.
CodeCop - Optional return value should not be omitted in upgrade codeunits.
CodeCop - The local method must be used; otherwise removed.
CodeCop - Version should not be specified for internal assemblies.
CodeCop - StrSubstNo or string concatenation must not be used as a parameter in the Error method.
CodeCop - The FlowField of a table should be indexed.
CodeCop - Use Get, FindFirst and FindLast without Next method.
CodeCop - When using OnInstallAppPerCompany you should also add Company-Initialize::OnCompanyInitialize event subscriber.
CodeCop - The name of non-temporary variables must not be prefixed with Temp.
CodeCop - Email and Phone No must not be present in any part of the source code.
CodeCop - Use all lowercase letters for reserved language keywords.
CodeCop - Limit JIT loads by selecting all fields for load.
CodeCop - Running an upgrade codeunit is not allowed.
CodeCop - Do not use identical names for parameters and global variables.
CodeCop - To avoid confusion, do not give parameters the same name as fields, methods, or actions in the same scope.
CodeCop - Suppressing all diagnostics is not allowed.
CodeCop - Use namespaces to organize your code and isolate it from changes.
CodeCop - You must use the FieldCaption method instead of the FieldName method and TableCaption method instead of TableName method.
CodeCop - The CalcDate should only be used with DataFormula variables. Alternatively the string should be enclosed using the symbols.
CodeCop - Placeholders should have a comment explaining their content.
AppSourceCop - Unsupported page property change.
AppSourceCop - Removing properties that cause destructive changes is not allowed.
AppSourceCop - The AppSourceCop configuration must specify the list of countries regions targeted by the application.
AppSourceCop - The country region codes specified in the supportedCountries property must be valid ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes.
AppSourceCop - Translations must be provided for all the locales in which the application will be available.
AppSourceCop - The ObsoleteTag property and the Tag in the Obsolete attribute must be set to the next release version.
AppSourceCop - Obsolete Tag must be set.
AppSourceCop - The Obsolete Tag must be the same across branches.
AppSourceCop - Obsolete Reason must be set.
AppSourceCop - TObsolete Tag format.
AppSourceCop - An affix is required for procedures defined in extension objects.
AppSourceCop - InternalsVisibleTo should not be used as a security feature.
AppSourceCop - The ID range assigned to the extension must be within the allowed range.
AppSourceCop - Use the application property instead of specifying explicit dependencies.
AppSourceCop - Fields must not increase in length.
AppSourceCop - Translations of enum value captions must not contain commas.
AppSourceCop - At the moment we do not use telemetry.
AppSourceCop - Permission Sets should not be defined in XML files.
AppSourceCop - An affix is needed.
AppSourceCop - The member ID should be within the allowed range.
AppSourceCop - Table definitions must have a matching permission set.
AppSourceCop - The type of the table has changed from Normal to Temporary.
AppSourceCop - Permission set extensions should not include permissions for objects defined in another application.
AppSourceCop - Permission set extensions should not include permission sets defined in another application.
AppSourceCop - Permission set extensions should not include permission sets which include permissions for objects defined in another application.
AppSourceCop - Permission set extensions should not include wildcard permissions.
AppSourceCop - Source application for the moved symbol cannot be found.
AppSourceCop - Application object is moved without the use of PendingMove.
AppSourceCop - The value of the MovedTo property in the source symbol does not match the destination AppId.
AppSourceCop - The value of the MovedFrom property in the destination object does not match the source AppId.
AppSourceCop - Source symbol for the moved symbol cannot be found in the package with the given AppId.
AppSourceCop -InternalsVisibleTo should not specifying a different publisher name than the one of this extension.
AppSourceCop - Objects should be placed in a namespace with at least two levels.
PerTenantExtensionCop - InternalsVisibleTo should not be used as a security feature.
PerTenantExtensionCop - Permission Sets should not be defined in XML files.
PerTenantExtensionCop - Permission set extensions should not include permissions for objects defined in another application.
PerTenantExtensionCop - Permission set extensions should not include permission sets defined in another application.
PerTenantExtensionCop - Permission set extensions should not include permission sets which include permissions for objects defined in another application.
PerTenantExtensionCop - Permission set extensions should not include wildcard permissions.
PerTenantExtensionCop - Use the application property instead of specifying an explicit dependency on Base Application.
PerTenantExtensionCop - The member ID should be within the allowed range.
PerTenantExtensionCop - The enum ordinal value should be within the allowed range.
UICop - The Web client does not support displaying the Request page of XMLPorts.
UICop - The Web client does not support displaying both Actions and Fields in Cue Groups. Only Fields will be displayed.
UICop - The Web client does not support displaying Repeater controls containing Parts.
UICop - A Blob cannot be used as a source expression for a page field.
UICop - Actions should use the Image property.
UICop - Pages and reports should use the UsageCategory and ApplicationArea properties to be searchable.
UICop - The Web client only supports displaying Repeater controls in pages of type List, ListPart, and Worksheet.
UICop - Using a Blob with subtype Bitmap on a page field is deprecated. Instead use the Media MediaSet data types.
UICop - A Repeater control used on a List page must be defined at the beginning of the area Content section.
UICop - Add PromotedOnly=true to some or all promoted actions to avoid identical actions from appearing in both the promoted and default sections of the command bar.
UICop - The Web client does not support properties for teaching tips in certain contexts.
UICop - Groups containing promoted actions should not be hidden.
UICop - Groups containing ActionRef targets should not be hidden.
UICop - Actions with scope repeater must be promoted.
UICop - Rich Text Editor fields are only allowed while alone in a FastTab group.
